alert.note: Alert for Huron; Lapeer; Sanilac; St. Clair (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 3:39PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A line of thunderstorms will impact portions of Sanilac, eastern Lapeer, northern St. Clair and eastern Huron Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 338 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of thunderstorms extending from 6 miles west of Port Hope to near Sandusky to near Imlay City. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds to 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Sandusky around 415 PM EDT. Port Hope around 420 PM EDT. Harbor Beach around 425 PM EDT. Deckerville around 445 PM EDT. Carsonville around 500 PM EDT. Applegate around 505 PM EDT. Yale and Port Sanilac around 515 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include North Street, Goodland Township, Parisville, Huron City, Lynn Township, White Rock, Rapson, Amador, Brockway and Juhl. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
